website_summaries.verdict: Yamaha’s latest soundbar provides comprehensive, crisp sound; includes wireless subwoofer.
pros: The best soundbar Yamaha offers connects to a smart TV via HDMI cable and is controlled through Bluetooth
Comes with subwoofer, which pairs wirelessly
Can pair wirelessly with other Yamaha speakers through MusicCast
cons: Must use well-produced content to get the most out of the speakers

website_summaries.verdict: The full-featured Yamaha MusicCast Bar 400 offers a palpable sonic upgrade for your television over cheap sound bars.
pros: The Yamaha MusicCast Bar 400 offers a wealth of connectivity and wireless streaming options
The home theater performance, coupled with its ability to add wireless rears, means the bar can rub shoulders with more expensive models such as the Sony
cons: No lights on the front and "always on" video can make it hard to tell if the unit is on or off
Setting up the wireless surround speakers wasn't as straightforward as it was with the compatible Yamaha receiver
No Dolby Atmos or Google Chromecast

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable , but not great ....
customer_reviews.text: Too much high, not enough mid tones. The bass is overly low and rumbling. It does not have a crisp 'punch'. Disappointed in the power delivery .. The main bar is 48 watts , the subwoofer 18 ... There are no real mid range speakers. They are 2 small dome speakers per side plus a tweeter. No audio controls whatsoever. no bass,mid,treble or equalizer. I expected more from a company like Yamaha. Main goal is to listen to music coming from airplay source. I am not using this for voice or tv . Nobody seems to make a good stereo network player anymore ..
customer_reviews.author: vincent himpe

customer_reviews.title: May not be compatible with your Tv
customer_reviews.text: This product is so difficult to set up. My husband has been trying to get this to stay connected to our Samsung TV for a few days now, and oh my what a pain!! I keep telling him to just return it, but doesn’t want to deal with the difficulty of that process so we are stuck with this!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So easy to set up, works well filling vaulted 13x15 room
customer_reviews.text: Ease of use. I connected power, one optical cable and touched the power button. CHanged TV to optical audio output (Samsung smart TV) and pulled the plastic battery blocker from the remote -- viola! Stereo sound. I did notice what sounded like static in some Tidal streaming music, but as I played it, it was less noticeable. I have not setup any non-default sound settings in the unit. Nice finish. ALl parts were present. Arrive so fast! No damage. Happy with purchase. I have other Yamaha products and this is the second MusicCast device in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Jimminy Cricket

customer_reviews.title: Music quality is great in Stereo Mode
customer_reviews.text: The music quality is great on this unit! Compared to my excellent-sounding computer speakers, this system is even better. I can hear lyrics that I did not know were even there. This is true in the Stereo mode. The other modes are not quite as clear. The Clear Voice mode is outstanding - for the first time I can listen to TV shows and understand all the dialogue. No real downside. I wish the bar were a bit less deep, so it could go under my TV without sticking out, but I would keep the depth rather than losing the sound quality. Would recommend or buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M

customer_reviews.title: It was pretty bad.
customer_reviews.text: First, MusicCast, Yamaha's whole home audio solution. It runs off UPnP, and it's as buggy and unreliable as every other UPnP platform out there. Sometimes it sees the server, sometimes it doesn't. Sometimes it can communicate with the server, sometimes it can. Junk. And it's the only reason this might be worth $450.00. On sound quality, I replaced it with a $180 Polk sound bar that sounds better. Enough said. Special note: The sub is weird. It's there, it adds bass. But there's a weird delay I've never heard with any other wireless subwoofer setup. It's almost like you're listening to a second system on a just-long-enough delay to throw everything off.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound if you get it at the right price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: * Great sound quality in a relatively small frame. * Setup was quick and easy. * 3D Surround Sound / DTS Virtual X sounds good with the right content. * Plethora of ways to connect and they work great. * App is pretty well designed and thought out. Cons: * No display on the front at all. If i need to check any of the status lights i need to walk over to it. * 3D Surround can sound bad in some applications, not a big deal though, it’s not meant for everything. * Not great value at list price of 499. I was able to get it used through Amazon Warehouse for much less.

customer_reviews.title: Great mid-priced sound bar
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice all-in-one sound bar that goes well with any TV where you want a low-profile sound system. The sound bar itself is sleek and understated, and brackets are included for wall mounting if desired. The wireless subwoofer is large and has a really nice heft to it. Setup was very easy, especially if your TV has an HDMI connection with ARC capabilities. (If not, you can also connect the sound bar via an optical audio cable.) Sound quality is very good for a sound bar. Sound bars can't really compete with multi-speaker systems, but in many rooms you may not want to deal with all the wires or installation issues involved with setting up satellite speakers.
